title: Celebration marks Christ statue's anniversary
text:
Celebration marks Christ statue's anniversary Tools 
  5:01   12, 2015 at 5:01 PM EDT 
RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) â€” Hundreds of Brazilians and foreign tourists have ascended the mountain overlooking Rio de Janeiro to celebrate the 84th anniversary of Brazil's iconic Christ the Redeemer statue. 
The 98-foot-tall statue took 9 years to build and was opened to the public on October 12, 1931. Its perch more than 2,000 feet above the coastal city has made it a symbol of Christianity around the world. 
Monday's anniversary celebration included a birthday cake and the singing of "Happy Birthday" in Portuguese. 
Canadian tourist Karen Southerland says she didn't know Monday was the statue's anniversary, but was excited to be part of the celebration. 
Sound: Upcoming
